natural problem: Simplify the following expression: $(9x^9+7x^8+4x^7) + (x^{11}+x^9+2x^7+3x^3+5x+8).$ Express your answer as a polynomial with the degrees of the terms in decreasing order.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 9 * x powr 9 + 7 * x powr 8 + 4 * x powr 7"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 11 + x powr 9 + 2 * x powr 7 + 3 * x powr 3 + 5 * x + 8"
shows  "(P x + Q x) = x powr 11 + 10 * x powr 9 + 7 * x powr 8 + 6 * x powr 7 + 3 * x powr 3 + 5 * x + 8"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify the following expression: $(9x^9+7x^8+4x^7) + (x^{11}+x^9+2x^7+3x^3+5x+8).$ Express your answer as a polynomial with the degrees of the terms in decreasing order. The final Answer is x^{11}+10x^9+7x^8+6x^7+3x^3+5x+8
 ### Proof
 We have  \begin{align} &(9x^9+7x^8+4x^7) + (x^{11}+x^9+2x^7+3x^3+5x+8)\\ &=x^{11}+(9+1)x^9+7x^8+(4+2)x^7+3x^3+5x+8\\ &=\boxed{x^{11}+10x^9+7x^8+6x^7+3x^3+5x+8}\\ \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 9 * x powr 9 + 7 * x powr 8 + 4 * x powr 7"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 11 + x powr 9 + 2 * x powr 7 + 3 * x powr 3 + 5 * x + 8"
shows  "(P x + Q x) = x powr 11 + 10 * x powr 9 + 7 * x powr 8 + 6 * x powr 7 + 3 * x powr 3 + 5 * x + 8"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the sum of the two polynomials: $9x^9 + 7x^8 + 4x^7$ and $x^{11} + x^9 + 2x^7 + 3x^3 + 5x + 8$. The final answer is $x^{11} + 10x^9 + 7x^8 + 6x^7 + 3x^3 + 5x + 8$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 9 * (x powr 9) + 7 * (x powr 8) + 4 * (x powr 7)"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = (x powr 11) + (x powr 9) + 2 * (x powr 7) + 3 * (x powr 3) + 5 * x + 8"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = P x + Q x"
shows  "\<forall> x. R x = (x powr 11) + 10 * (x powr 9) + 7 * (x powr 8) + 6 * (x powr 7) + 3 * (x powr 3) + 5 * x + 8"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify the following expression: $(9x^9+7x^8+4x^7) + (x^{11}+x^9+2x^7+3x^3+5x+8).$ Express your answer as a polynomial with the degrees of the terms in decreasing order. The final Answer is x^{11}+10x^9+7x^8+6x^7+3x^3+5x+8
 ### Proof
 We have  \begin{align} &(9x^9+7x^8+4x^7) + (x^{11}+x^9+2x^7+3x^3+5x+8)\\ &=x^{11}+(9+1)x^9+7x^8+(4+2)x^7+3x^3+5x+8\\ &=\boxed{x^{11}+10x^9+7x^8+6x^7+3x^3+5x+8}\\ \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 9 * (x powr 9) + 7 * (x powr 8) + 4 * (x powr 7)"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = (x powr 11) + (x powr 9) + 2 * (x powr 7) + 3 * (x powr 3) + 5 * x + 8"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = P x + Q x"
shows  "\<forall> x. R x = (x powr 11) + 10 * (x powr 9) + 7 * (x powr 8) + 6 * (x powr 7) + 3 * (x powr 3) + 5 * x + 8"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem:
Given two functions: 

$P(x) = 9x^9 + 7x^8 + 4x^7$ 

and 

$Q(x) = x^{11} + x^9 + 2x^7 + 3x^3 + 5x + 8$, 

and a third function defined as 

$R(x) = P(x) + Q(x)$, 

show that for all $x$, 

$R(x) = x^{11} + 10x^9 + 7x^8 + 6x^7 + 3x^3 + 5x + 8$.
